phrases.text: Hò hẻ hò hè Hò hẻ hò hè

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). Lullabies sung by mothers across all regions of Vietnam.
facts: Each region has distinct lullaby styles with local characteristics
Often express mothers' hopes, worries, and love for children
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This onomatopoeia phrase contains 8 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Onomatopoetic phrases use repeated notes or simple patterns to imitate sounds. Soft, repetitive melodies with gentle rocking rhythm.

phrases.text: Bồong bổong bồong bồong bồong bổong bồong bồong Hò ơ ơ ơ

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). This narrative phrase advances the story, grounding the emotional content in concrete imagery. Lullabies sung by mothers across all regions of Vietnam.
facts: Each region has distinct lullaby styles with local characteristics
Often express mothers' hopes, worries, and love for children
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This narrative phrase contains 12 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Narrative phrases typically use moderate melodic range and steady rhythm to advance the story. Soft, repetitive melodies with gentle rocking rhythm.

phrases.text: Ai về đất Cảnh hôm nay Ra khơi mà vào động sóng reo sớm chiều

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "chiều" - evening - time of reflection and melancholy. The exclamatory form adds emotional emphasis, common in Vietnamese folk music to engage listeners. Lullabies sung by mothers across all regions of Vietnam.
facts: Each region has distinct lullaby styles with local characteristics
Often express mothers' hopes, worries, and love for children
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This exclamatory phrase contains 15 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. As an exclamatory phrase, it likely features sustained notes or ascending contours for emotional expression. Soft, repetitive melodies with gentle rocking rhythm.
